page.title: 09 Knight's Farm (Dairy)
page.content: Knight's Farm is on a private small holding of 59 acres along Newton Road, run by two people. The farm has about 200 acres of land most of which is rented and is well spread out. The fields away from the farm are used for young stock but mostly for cut grass to keep as silage. The farm mostly has cows and a few calves, their end product is milk. This is sold to be bottled but some goes to cheese and butter manufacturers. The milk has to be of a high standard so the equipment must be kept clean. There are about 150 calves born each year, 75 of these are male which are sent off for beef production; at present they have 130 cows. During the winter they feed the stock on silage, although sometimes they use wheat and spring barley.
